Bloom

This little figma plugin helps you to create parameterized flower / star vector shape with ease.

You can explore combinations of parameters to create your own favorite shapes.

plugins.name: Markdown to Sticker
plugins.description:
Markdown to Sticker

Transform your markdown text into beautifully organized FigJam stickers with just a few clicks. This plugin helps you quickly convert text notes into visual elements for your FigJam boards, perfect for brainstorming sessions, planning meetings, and collaborative workshops.


Key Features:

  1. Convert markdown text to FigJam stickers
  2. Customize colors, shapes, and opacity
  3. Automatic color-coding for task-related keywords
  4. Organized grid layout
  5. Simple validation


How to Use:

  1. Enter your markdown text in the editor.
  2. Each line starting with "-" creates a new sticker.
  3. Add customization options with indented lines starting with "".
  4. Click "Validate" to check your syntax.
  5. Click "Import" to create your stickers in FigJam.


Customization Options:

  1. color: red, green, blue, yellow, purple, orange, pink, gray, black
  2. wide: true/false (rectangular or square shape)
  3. opacity: 0.0-1.0 (transparency level)
  4. authorVisible: true/false (show author name)


Streamline your FigJam workflow by quickly converting text notes into visually organized stickers. Perfect for teams who prepare content in text format and want to seamlessly bring it into their visual collaboration space.
plugins.tagline: Convert markdown text into customizable FigJam stickers with simple formatting options

plugins.name: Export local variables to Json
plugins.description:
Plugin Overview

This plugin takes Local Variables of Figma and outputs them as a JSON file in Style Dictionary format. This allows design tokens to be efficiently reflected in the code.


Main Functions

1. Get Local Variables

- Color values

- Spacing

- Typography

and other variables are automatically retrieved


2. Maintain hierarchical structure

// Maintain Figma structure (e.g.colors/primary/base) in JSON format
{
"colors": {
"primary": {
"base": {
"$value": "#1a2b3c",
"$type": "color"
}
}
}
}


3. Value Conversion

- Colors: Convert from RGBA to HEX format

- Numbers: Manage decimal precision

- Variable references: Properly resolve aliases


How to Use

1. Launch the plugin in Figma

2. Click the "Export" button

3. Download the generated JSON file


Features

- JSON output compliant with Style Dictionary format

- Simple UI

- Error fallback handling

- Comprehensive validation


Applications

- Design system construction

- Batch management of design tokens

- Synchronization with codebase


This plugin enables seamless bridging between design and code.
plugins.tagline: you can export all local variables as json

plugins.name: MotionPoint Translator
plugins.description:
Overview

Unlock the full potential of your Figma designs with our state-of-the-art plugin. Designed for seamless integration, this tool brings professional translation services into your Figma workflow, automating the creation of translated versions of your designs.


Seamless Integration

Bridge the gap between design and global communication by automating the generation of translated Figma designs. Our plugin ensures your UI/UX resonates with audiences worldwide, offering both human and machine translation options.


Simple Steps to Localization

Language Selection: Start by choosing the languages you want to translate your design into, ensuring a wide-reaching impact.

Translation Quality: Select the desired level of translation quality—opt for Human Translation for nuanced accuracy or Machine Translation for swift turnaround.

Translation Progress: Monitor the translation's progress with ease. Our plugin keeps you updated every step of the way.

Import Translations: Once translations are complete, import them directly from the Progress tab or use the Import tab to generate the translated designs for all selected languages


Effortless Process

With minimal effort, watch as your Figma projects elevate to an international standard. Our plugin simplifies the complexities of localization, letting you focus on what you do best: creating stunning, culturally resonant designs.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly bridge Figma to professional translation, automating your content localization.

plugins.name: FlatMagic
plugins.description:
FlatMagic is a sleek and efficient Figma plugin that transforms complex frame structures into single, flattened images with just one click. Perfect for designers who need to simplify their workflows, create thumbnails, or preserve the exact appearance of their designs.


Key Features:

• One-Click Flattening: Transform any frame or group into a single image instantly

• Smart Selection: The plugin intelligently enables only when a frame or group is selected

• Original Positioning: Maintains exact position and dimensions of your original frame

• Clean Interface: Modern, minimal UI that follows Figma's design patterns

• Resource Efficient: Reduces file size by converting complex layer structures into single images


Use Cases:

• Creating thumbnails for design systems

• Preserving complex effects and interactions

• Simplifying handoff deliverables

• Reducing file size for better performance

• Maintaining visual consistency across shared components


How to Use:

1. Select any frame or group you want to flatten

2. Run FlatMagic

3. Click 'Flatten Selection'

4. Done! Your flattened frame is ready to use


Made with ❤️ by Opeyemi Ajagbe

117355.release_notes:
# FlatMagic v1.4.0 Release Notes

## 🚀 New Feature: Intelligent Quality Options

### Quality Selection Improvements
- Introduced dynamic quality option management for PNG exports
- Quality options now adapt based on frame dimensions
- Enhanced user experience with context-aware quality selections

### Key Changes
- For frames ≤ 1,200 x 1,200 pixels:
  - All quality options available (Default, High, Maximum)
- For frames > 1,200 x 1,200 pixels:
  - Only Default quality option available
- Default quality is now consistently set to 'Default'

### Benefits
- Prevents potential performance issues with large frames
- Provides clear, context-sensitive export options
- Maintains plugin stability across different frame sizes

## 🛠 Technical Improvements
- Refined UI initialization logic
- Improved event handling for quality option updates
- Enhanced test coverage for quality option scenarios

## Upgrade Recommendation
- Recommended for all users
- No breaking changes
- Improves overall export experience

plugins.name: ark-tailwind-codegen
plugins.description:
This plugin is based on Parbez's figma-tailwindcss plugin


It uses ARK's custom Tailwind theme to convert Figma's CSS output into tailwind classes that can be used in conjunction with our design system.


The source code is available on Github


How to use

  1. Click the Open in... button and choose the file you want to use it in
  2. Go to your file and make sure you’re in Dev Mode (if there are green buttons in the UI, you’re in the right place 👌)
  3. Select the layers you want to generate the class names for
  4. Make sure you have the Inspect panel open on the right-hand side
  5. Scroll down to the 'tailwindcss' section et voilà ✨


  1. If you don’t see this section but instead see an Inspect layer properties button, click it and you should see that section appear
  2. If you still can’t see the section, make sure you’ve got `ark-tailwind-code` plugin selected from dropdown at the top-right of the `Code` section


Todo

  1. [ ] Import tailwind theme from @ark/theming
  2. [ ] Custom typography classes
  3. [ ] Convert layout variables to classes
  4. [ ] Prettier?
plugins.tagline: Convert Figma's css output into tailwind classes that match our custom theme.

plugins.name: Huima
plugins.description:
Huima


Translate designs into development-ready code at lightning speed


Let me automatically handle the tedious task of comparing and reproducing dull design drafts! Export UI-consistent, clean, and tidy frontend code with just one click, allowing frontend engineers to focus on dynamic design and business logic development.


The project is currently in development, and many features may not be stable. If you encounter any bugs or have something to tell us, feel free to leave a message in the GitHub issue. Yes, the code is also there, it's open source.


Features


  • Export page code and static resources that match the design draft with a single click.
  • Support for automatic layout and generation of positioning styles.
  • Support for copying code of any node online.
  • Support for responsive layout units such as rem and vw.
  • Support for partial tailwindcss style conversion.
  • Support for online preview, including font styles.
  • Support for converting styles of most node types to the web environment.


Design Conventions


Converting designs accurately into code is a challenging task that often requires close collaboration between designers and developers, fully understanding the working methods and limitations of each tool.


  • Rotation is not currently supported.


Rendering Conventions


To generate more concise code, the following conventions are applied during rendering:


  • When rendering groups, only the outermost group is rendered by default if nested.
plugins.tagline: Translate designs into development-ready code at lightning speed

plugins.name: Heuristic Checker - BETA
plugins.description:
Heuristic Checker is your design quality companion that automatically analyzes your Figma designs against UI/UX best practices and accessibility guidelines.


Key Features:

• Typography Consistency Check: Ensures consistent font styles, sizes, and line heights across your design system

• Button Consistency Check: Validates button styles, sizes, and states for a cohesive user experience

• Color Contrast Check: Verifies text readability and WCAG compliance

• Design Recommendations: Provides actionable suggestions to improve your design quality


Perfect for:

• Design Teams: Maintain consistency across large design systems

• UI/UX Designers: Catch inconsistencies before they reach development

• Product Managers: Ensure design quality meets project standards

• Developers: Verify design specifications before implementation


Start using Heuristic Checker today to streamline your design QA process and deliver pixel-perfect designs with confidence.


Currently Supported Checks (Beta):

1. Typography Consistency

• Line height consistency

• Font family consistency

• Text style consistency across similar elements


2. Button Consistency

• Size and padding verification

• Typography standards for button labels

• Border radius consistency

• Visual hierarchy in button variants


3. Color Contrast

• Text contrast against backgrounds (WCAG compliance)

• Icon contrast verification

• Color accessibility recommendations


Note: More checks and features will be added in future updates. We welcome your feedback and suggestions for additional checks!

117258.release_notes:
# Heuristic Checker v0.2.0 Release Notes
January 27, 2025

## 🎉 New Features

### Icon Contrast Improvements
- Enhanced icon contrast validation with role-based requirements
- Improved opacity handling for layered icons
- Added support for interactive, informative, and decorative icon roles
- Implemented proper color blending calculations for accurate contrast measurement

### Color Utilities
- Added new color utility functions for precise color manipulation
- Implemented linear RGB color space calculations for accurate blending
- Added support for hex color conversion and contrast ratio calculation

plugins.name: Vector to Rectangle
plugins.description:
The Problem

When importing Illustrator files into Figma, rectangles often get converted to vector shapes, losing their adjustable properties like corner radius. This can be a huge headache, especially when dealing with numerous elements.


The Solution

This plugin automatically converts these vectorized rectangles back into native Figma rectangles, preserving their adjustable properties.


Key Features

  1. Automatically detects vectorized rectangles from Illustrator imports
  2. Converts vectors to native Figma rectangles with editable properties
  3. Preserves corner radii and other rectangle attributes
  4. Batch processing for multiple elements at once
  5. Significant time-saver for designers.

plugins.name: DoujinFigma
plugins.description:
# Doujin Figma - A Figma Plugin that help you make your own drawing with Stable Diffusion using Colab


Free and open source plugin for you to use Figma with Stable Diffusion.

Made this plugin for my friends so that it is easier for them to draw their Dojin Manga.

I made another Design Assistant which is called Design Wingman but it is harder to setup.

While this plugin is easier to setup.


- [x] Text to Image

- [x] Image to Image

- [x] Inpaint

- [x] Remove Background

- [ ] Segment Anything

- [x] Support Colab

- [x] Support Localhost

- [ ] Support Free to use Demo (No Localhost nor Colab needed)


## Installation

Open the following Colab Notebook

[Google Research fast-stable-diffusion]

(https://colab.research.google.com/github/TheLastBen/fast-stable-diffusion/blob/main/fast_stable_diffusion_AUTOMATIC1111.ipynb)

Follow the instruction and run all the cells.

Copy the generated URL at the very end of the Notebook and paste it onto the URL box on the very top of this plugin (Left side is URL, Right side is API keys).

For faster generate speed, it is recommended to use Stable Diffusion Turbo.

When you see the warning about Figma Extension, install the following plugin to your Stable Diffusion WebUi for full features if you want.

[DoujinFigma-AUTOMATIC1111-Extension](https://github.com/zeuscsc/DoujinFigma-AUTOMATIC1111-Extension.git)

Enjoy!

Shing Chung Z. Chiu
plugins.tagline: Free and open source plugin Figma to use Stable Diffusion to make Dojin Manga or Design Image.

plugins.name: Relinky - Scan and Replace Missing Tokens
plugins.description:
Relinky - Scan and Replace Missing Token


A powerful Figma plugin to help you find and manage unlinked design tokens and styles across your files. Inspired from other plugins like Similayer / Token studio


🔍 Scan all unlinked values

- Typography: Find text layers missing text style variables

- Spacing: Detect auto-layout frames with unlinked spacing

- Corner Radius: Identify shapes with unlinked corner radius

- Fill Colors: Find layers with unlinked fill colors

- Stroke Colors: Detect layers with unlinked stroke colors


🎯 Smart Selection

  1. Scan entire page or selected frames/components
  2. Group similar unlinked values for easy selection
  3. Quick selection of affected layers
  4. Navigate to specific instances


Working with Results

  1. Results are grouped by type and value for easier management
  2. Click on any result to select the affected layers in your design
  3. Replace and update missing tokens and links!
  4. Use the navigation arrows to jump between instances
  5. Apply suggested styles directly from the results panel


Tips

  1. Use the grouped results to quickly standardize similar unlinked values
  2. Regular scanning helps maintain design system consistency
  3. Consider scanning before sharing designs or creating documentation

accepted.name: Ivan Yeo
accepted.description: Design system | Product designer | Badminton Lover

98085.name: Spectacle
98085.description:
Simplify your workflow - transform designs into documentation.

Quickly generate precise specs for each selected layer, streamlining communication with developers.


Features include:

  1. selection indicators
  2. padding visuals
  3. detailed attribute lists
  4. layer analysis


We're just getting started—stay tuned for customizable settings and an in-depth guide.


We value your feedback—let us know how we can make Spectacle even better.
98085.release_notes:
Welcome to the latest release of Spectacle. This update brings you powerful enhancements to document generation, improved handling of auto layout properties, and better error management.

Key Highlights:

Improvements were made to the stacking order of elements in generated specification documents and enhances the handling of layout attributes for nodes with “Fill” and “Stretch” properties. Additionally, significant code refactoring has been done to streamline document generation, improve error handling, and ensure more reliable output.
  - Corrected Element Stacking Order: Refined the stacking order logic to ensure that layer badges, numbers, headers, and attributes are displayed in the correct sequence within the generated specification documents.
  - Improved Handling of Auto Layout Properties: Enhanced support for nodes with "Fill" and "Stretch" properties to accurately reflect these attributes in the generated documents.
  - Enhanced Error Handling: Added more robust error handling during document generation, allowing for better diagnostics and stability.
  - Modularized Code Structure: Refactored the codebase to improve maintainability and performance by splitting functionality into well-organized modules.
  - Automatic Selection Handling: Updated the selection management to automatically handle node selection changes more efficiently.

---

Bug Fixes:

Resolved an issue where the plugin did not correctly detect the initial selection upon opening.

Updated the plugin to accurately detect and display the selection count both upon initialization and whenever the selection changes.

All layers are now properly analyzed and included in the generated documentation. However, there are still issues with some attributes not being listed and empty layers being unnecessarily analyzed. These will be addressed in the next release.

---

Code Improvement:

Modularized Code Structure: The codebase has been significantly refactored to enhance maintainability and performance. Key components, such as badges, overlays, padding visuals, and text elements, have been separated into distinct modules within the `components`folder. This modular approach facilitates easier updates and better code organization.

Optimized Auto Layout Handling: The new `fitNodeToContainer` function within the `Container.ts` module ensures that nodes with "layoutGrow" and "layoutAlign" properties are correctly resized based on their parent's dimensions, providing a more accurate reflection of the design intent.

---

Enhanced Error Handling:

Layer Processing Error Management: The `generateDocumentStructure` function in `docHandler.ts` now includes try-catch blocks to handle errors during the processing of each layer. This ensures that the document generation process continues even if an issue occurs with a specific layer, with errors being logged for debugging purposes.

Improved Debugging Information: Additional logging has been introduced to capture more detailed information about the layer processing, aiding in troubleshooting and ensuring smoother operation.

---

Breaking Changes and Known Issues:

Preview Functionality: The preview feature is currently broken and does not display anything. We are aware of this issue and are actively working on a fix, which will be included in the next release.

Incomplete Attribute Listings: While all layers of a selection are now included in the documentation creation, some attributes are still not being listed, and empty layers are being analyzed. This is a known issue that will be addressed in the next update.

plugins.name: Semi Toolbox
plugins.description:
由 Semi 团队打造，一款基于为设计师提效的功能插件。


特征

  1. 内容填充 - 快速为你的设计稿批量填充带有格式的文本或者图片，同时我们引用了 AI 生成，快速帮你批量生成想要的文本
  2. 数据可视化生成 - 我们打通了 Semi DV 样式库，让你在 figma 终端直接生成对应的图表的同时输出代码，当前支持12种类型总共30种案例
  3. Semi 主题同步 - 快速同步你的自定义 Semi 主题到 UI Kit


如何使用

  1. 安装 plugin ，选择对应的功能分类
  2. 主题同步、切换账号以及语言切换，在导航栏的更多选项中


支持

  1. Design System Manage
  2. Semi Data Visualization


Developed by the Semi team, it is a functional plugin designed to boost the efficiency of designers.


Features

  1. Content Filling: Quickly batch - fill your design drafts with formatted text or images. Also, we've integrated AI generation to rapidly generate the desired text for you in batches.
  2. Data Visualization Generation: We've connected to the Semi DV style library, enabling you to directly generate corresponding charts in the Figma terminal and output code simultaneously. Currently, it supports 12 types with a total of 30 cases.
  3. Semi Theme Synchronization: Swiftly synchronize your custom Semi theme to the UI Kit.


How to Use

  1. Install the plugin and select the corresponding functional category.
  2. For theme synchronization, account switching, and language switching, find them in the "More" options of the navigation bar.


Support

  1. Design System Manage
  2. Semi Data Visualization

plugins.name: Custom GPT
plugins.description:
How to use:

1. Enter your OpenAI key

2. Configure Prompt. If you need to handle text inside elements, insert $text into the prompt.

3. Specify a temperature between 0 and 1. 

4. Click "run"

5. Click on the items that contain text. GPT will replace the text in these items.


Video of how it works: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yAVok8hDAwc


If you are using the plugin to improve your UX copywriting, choose the maximum temperature. This gives more freedom for the LLM, which positively affects the results. 


It is also recommended to use the following prompt structure:

Text: $text

(Insert indentation between the text and the task.)

Task Description.
plugins.tagline: A simple editor for fast text processing using the OpenAI API.

plugins.name: Text Translator By ChatGPT
plugins.description:
Text Translator 📝 allows you to effortlessly translate your text layers into multiple languages without leaving Figma. Supporting over 130 languages and integrated with the ChatGPT large language model, it provides fast and accurate translations. Preview your designs in different languages, catch localization layout issues early, and adapt your projects for new markets—all within your Figma workspace.


Key Features:

  1. 📝 Mixed Text Style Compatibility — Text Translator preserves the integrity of mixed text styles, ensuring that translated content retains the intended formatting and layout.
  2. 📝 Design-Wide Translation — Easily translate individual text layers or entire sections, groups, or frames for seamless multilingual conversion.
  3. 📝 Table Translation — Instantly translate the text within tables in your designs.
  4. 📝 Support for over 130 languages, enhanced by the ChatGPT large language model for smarter and more accurate translations.
  5. 📝 Integrated with Figma's Quick Actions, allowing you to quickly translate designs without navigating the plugin interface.
  6. 📝 Intelligent selection detection lets you translate entire layers, groups of layers, or specific text within a layer with a single button press.
  7. 📝 Keyboard input mode for translating non-design text such as text variables or quick communication with international teammates.


More

https://aluminum-skate-8b5.notion.site/Text-Translator-Figma-Plugin-12a4265e9ea280adaa79e6045069b709
plugins.tagline: Translate effortlessly with ChatGPT – your text layers, now multilingual

plugins.name: Accessibility Checklist
plugins.description:
Ensure your digital products meet basic accessibility standards with ease.


This plugin provides a comprehensive list of essential accessibility guidelines that every designer should adhere to. By keeping this checklist handy, you can ensure that your UI and components are inclusive and accessible to all users, regardless of their abilities.


—


How to use:

  1. Run the plugin and view the list of accessibility items organized into four categories.
  2. Manually evaluate your UI and components against each item on the checklist.
  3. Check items that your UI and successfully meets.
  4. Click "Generate Report" to create a comprehensive list of all items, highlighting areas that need improvement.


*Use this report for self-assessment or to seek assistance from others.


With the Accessibility Checklist plugin, you can confidently design digital products that are accessible to everyone.


—


Made with ❤️ in México using Cursor AI and Claude 3.5. Feedback is appreciated —thank you!
plugins.tagline: A handy tool to ensure your UI and components meet essential accessibility standards.

plugins.name: SimpleLocalize: Localization plugin for multi-language design
plugins.description:
Simplify your app localization workflow right from Figma.


SimpleLocalize for Figma helps you preview your designs in multiple languages with just a few clicks. Connect your project to pull translations directly from SimpleLocalize and see how your UI looks in different languages, right inside Figma.


Quick start:

  1. Create SimpleLocalize project, add languages
  2. Open up SimpleLocalize plugin in Figma
  3. Select text elements
  4. Hit "Push translations"
  5. Auto-translate texts
  6. Change the language in Figma plugin and hit "Pull translations"
  7. Done!


Automatically generate translation keys with screenshots, and upload new or updated text back to your SimpleLocalize project. No more manual work or version confusion.

Whether you're building global products or collaborating with localization teams, SimpleLocalize makes it easy to manage translations during the design stage.


If you have any issues or suggestions, hit us up on figma@simplelocalize.io or create an issue here: https://simplelocalize.io/feature-requests
plugins.tagline: Localization made simple for global design

plugins.name: OKLCH Color Ramp
plugins.description:
Overview

The OKLCH Color Ramp Generator is a powerful Figma plugin designed to help designers create beautiful, perceptually uniform color scales using the OKLCH color space. This innovative tool addresses the common challenge of creating consistent and visually pleasing color ramps in design systems.


Key Features


1. Advanced Color Space Implementation

- Utilizes the OKLCH color space, which offers superior color interpolation compared to traditional RGB or HSL

- Ensures perceptually uniform steps between colors, making the resulting ramps more visually harmonious

- Provides more accurate color relationships, especially important for accessibility and design system consistency


2. User-Friendly Interface

- Simple and intuitive input system for base colors

- Customizable number of steps in the color ramp (default: 12)

- One-click generation of complete color scales


3. Smart Layout and Organization

- Automatically arranges color swatches in a horizontal layout

- Includes color information display (hex codes and intended OKLCH values)

- Automatic selection and zoom to the generated color ramp

- Clean, organized presentation of color information


Benefits for Designers


1. Time Efficiency

- Rapid generation of color scales

- Eliminates manual color interpolation

- Reduces the chance of errors in color calculations


2. Design Quality

- Ensures consistent visual steps between colors

- Creates more accessible color combinations

- Maintains color harmony across the design system


3. Workflow Integration

- Seamlessly fits into existing Figma workflows

- Provides immediate visual feedback

- Easy to iterate and adjust color scales


Future Development

The plugin is actively maintained with planned improvements:

- Enhanced color information display

- Additional customization options for color ramp generation

- Request feature in comments
plugins.tagline: Generate stunning, perceptually uniform color ramps effortlessly.

plugins.name: Variables Editor
plugins.description:
Take control of your variables with the updated Variables Editor plugin. Designed to simplify variable management in Figma, this version lets you edit linked variables directly, avoid complex navigation, and keep your workflow smooth and intuitive.


Key Features:

  1. Edit variables in place: Select any text linked to a variable and start editing it right there — no need to dig through nested structures or remember paths.
  2. Reference-aware updates: Seamlessly edit variables that reference others. Your changes automatically apply to the final target without breaking the original links.
  3. Multi-line inputs with line breaks: Edit values in spacious fields with full support for line breaks, giving you more flexibility than native controls.
  4. Undo changes instantly: Easily revert variable names or values to their previous state with a single click.
  5. Quick variable creation: Add new variables directly to the current collection, right next to the selected variable, without leaving the editing context.
  6. Resizable interface: Adjust the plugin window and input fields to suit your needs, whether working with simple text or complex structures.


Perfect for localization, UI text management, and advanced variable workflows, the Variables Editor plugin is here to help you focus on design, not tedious variable navigation.


How to assign a shortcut to the “Variables Editor” plugin:

  1. Go to System Preferences > Keyboard > Shortcuts.
  2. Select App Shortcuts from the left-hand menu.
  3. Click the + button to create a new shortcut.
  4. Set Application to Figma.
  5. Enter Variables Editor (exact plugin name) in the Menu Title field.
  6. Assign your desired shortcut (e.g., ⌘ + `)
  7. Click Add to confirm.


Your plugin is now accessible using ⌘ + `!
plugins.tagline: Find and edit variables directly in place, without navigating nested structures or losing focus.
